review: We have always loved coming to Chili's... over the years the quality of service has dwindled down. Tonight my son and I walked in and there was a line at the hostess stand. Looked like servers were hosting and serving. We were sat within 5 minutes, but sat at the table for another 5 before the server acknowledged us. Then another 5 before she came to get our drink order. My guess, she was swamped with tables. I was under the impression that it was going to be one of those nights where it's just all going to be bad. However, the server, Tina I believe, was very polite and took our food and drink order immediately. We were served hot and very very good food right away and she was very kind to check on us multiple times. She made our unexpected going out to eat dinner a nice one and we will go to bed full and happy.

There were a string of visits where the service was terrible. However I love the chicken enchilada soup and the margaritas so I keep coming back. The service has been average the last few times not as crappy as previous experiences. As long as they keep the margaritas, I'll keep coming back

I always have a great experience at chili's. I come here often and the service is always good and my food as well. I usually order the chips and salsa, cheese bites, the Cajun chicken pasta with shrimp, the salmon, and the triple dipper. Those are my favorites! Today I came in and I had the triple dipper with southwestern egg rolls, burger bites, and boneless buffalo wings. For an appetizer I had the cheese bites and the chips and salsa with the skillet queso. Everything was delicious. I also had a platinum margarita which is always very tasty. I would recommend getting on the rewards program you earn lots of points to get free of your favorites! Thank you Chili's!

Stopped in for dinner on a Friday night . Of course it was packed , people sitting outside and inside waiting for a table . Luckily I had reserved a table for my family and I threw the yelp app . When we got their we walked right in and sat down ! I'm definitely gonna be doing this more often . Worked perfectly !

Worst service ever tonight.  Server took forever to check drink refills.  She then had wrong Kiosk on our table with a much higher bill and took 1/2 hour to correct the situation.  She could not figure out how to give us the dessert in My Rewards, and the manager took 20 minutes before saying she found a coupon we could use instead.  We left without dessert and will never go back again.

I sat at the bar when it wasn't too busy.  About 1:30pm.  It took a good 10 minutes before the bartender showed up to greet me. I ordered their happy hour apps and a water.  One modification to my Texas cheese fries, and they couldn't even get that correct.  Bartender kept disappearing.  I will try to come here again in hopes of a better experience.

While I understand that this is a "beginners" restaurant job, I feel like the hostess today was just incompetent.  I walked up to the door with my cousin in a wheelchair where I could BARELY open the door by myself and the hostess couldn't be bothered AS SHE'S STARING AT ME THROUGH THE DOOR. My cousin is also pretty young and she didn't even think to give me a child's menu, just walked to the table without even asking.  Whatever, our waitress was amazing so I tried to forget about it...until it was time to leave.  Please help me understand why when it's so dead the hostess couldn't AGAIN open the door for me to get out with the wheelchair in hand and I had to get outside help to get us in.  Chilis please re-train your blonde hostess at the front. Absolutely no manners, and I'm sick of it.

My family and I went to Chili's for lunch after 5 yrs since our previous location did not have any in our area. It was a late lunch so e place was not busy at all. Our food took about 20 mins before it got to our table. By then my pasta tasted warm and the chicken seemed like it was frozen and cooked directly onto the grill. It was tasty but pasta served as luke warm is not as good.  Maybe it was just past the lunch hour rush or the cooks were slow or not enough cooks in the kitchen. Whatever it was the overall service and quality was average for me. My kids love to go to Chili's but we'll just have to try other places to make the comparison.  Hope this helps choosing which spot to go to.

Terrible hosting done up front. I went with family to celebrate my husband swearing in to the Army yesterday and we waited over an hour and a half before I frankly had enough waiting. I spoke with the manager and she had nothing but excuses! She had no clue what was going on up at the hostess desk. People barely coming in were being seated before us, which I didn't feel was fair at all! Needles to say our night was ruined. My husband leaves in a week for 14wks and instead of last night being a good memory, it'll go down as one of the worst nights I've ever had. Thank you Chili's. I am never stepping a foot into any of your establishments again!

Very unhappy with my experience today. Ordered a beer, was never offered a refill. Also, I believe the beer was the wrong size. Food was mediocre, at best. My "crispy buffalo bleu" came out with ranch instead of blue cheese. The waitress seemed very busy, and she didn't really want to help us. I'm sorry for the people that decide to eat here in the near future.

It's a great go to place for quick dinner. Sat at bar good happy hour prices.  Currently they have appetizer two full entrees, dessert and two presidente shakers for 35 dollars.  This saves you 5-10 dollars depending on happy hour times.  Molten chocolate cake is a must !! So full we took to go
The queso and chips were ok and my boyfriend liked his chili. However, my fries were cold and stale and my club sandwich had only one slice of bacon on it :(

Slowest, non-existent service. Restaurant was probably 2/3 empty.  The girl took our order then was no where to be found afterwards--not even when we needed a to-go box or to pay the tab.  I had to flag down the guy in a tie (manager?) and even he could care less that our server was no where to be found.  My mentioning of "our server never came around" didn't phase him one bit.  Of course, Chili's have the convenient mini machines on each table and so servers don't even have to come back to collect the check.   Got their Meal for 2 ($20): 1 appetizer, 2 entrees Margherita flatbread - pretty good 6 oz sirloin (not bad) with loaded mashed potatoes, sub Southwestern mac and cheese--creamy and pretty good Canjun chicken pasta - sweet and creamy. weird. wasn't a fan I normally like their southwestern egg rolls, mini sliders, and spinach artichoke dip. Overall, food was decent. Service from servers & management -- horrible. Poorly managed businesses never last.  Good luck!
Good salads we got. Waitress took forever to go come by and fried pickles were too soft. It was an okay experience.
Terrible customer service. It took 15 minutes to even have someone ask us what we wanted to drink! Very understaffed.

So..., just because the staff is running around getting order's out and may feel warm... I have to eat my meal at near freezing temperatures? Please!!!! It's 57 degrees in here, wth??? And..., the chef obviously doesn't know what a medium rare steak is! And..., the wait & mgmt staff thinks it's o.k. to sweep beside your table while you're eating! I'm so done w/ Chili's, forever! FOREVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

location: Near East Side, San Antonio, TX
review: Excellent fried cauliflower!  Service and food were great!

Chilis in the forum is awful. I happen to love Chilis but last Wednesday my family went there and it was the worst service I have ever had anywhere. We went in at 9pm with a party of 14 which i know is alot but we were willing to be patient. The host said it would be a bit before we were sat but then after 20 mins and about half the restaurant empty we started to ask if we could push some tables together to atleast be seated and the host said NO. We waited another 10 mins with nothing changing and were told we would have to sit in seperate tables since they were refusing to push tables together in an empty area. We agreed. We waited another 10 minutes and the manager rudly came out to tell us we were a large party and were inconveniencing them and if we wanted to stay we had to sit in seperate table which we told him we had agreed to 10 minutes ago. Finally after 45 minutes of waiting and rude service we were seated. Not only were we sat in 3 different tables they werent even close to eachother. We sat at tables for 10 minutes with no service and decided to leave. If i could give them zero stars i would. I will be going to different locations from now on.
After eating I took my baby brother to use the bathroom. An old dude walks in. Used the urinal, and walks right back out and into the kitchen without washing his hands.

The ONLY reason I'm giving this place 5 stars is because of Archer, he is a phenomenal server. He's very personable and professional. You are lucky to have him. He made our visit super enjoyable and turned the day around for us. We will be back!
Hair in food. Enough said. This after thirty minute wait at bar. Hardly worth my time or money.
This is the best place to have lunch the servers are friendly and so is the management really enjoyed this Chili's
Their food just taste the same as other chili's.  This is my 3rd time to give them a chance!!  Disappointed!  I will stick with my local joint.

Well I'm a big chilis fan for years.  Even as their service and food flounders.  Today took the cake.  Enticed by a $10 you deserve it club member coupon if you spend $30 I went for dinner.  I ordered grilled chicken salad $8.79, chicken crisper $10.19, guacamole 4.99.  That all fell under 2 for 20.  Also got two margaritas.  So bill was over $40.  They refused coupon because they said 2/20 was special offer.  Look at online menu where does it say special and coupon does not say no 2/20.  The truth is a la carts they total $23.97 so add drinks I'm still ahead $6 a la cattle with coupon.  I have ate at chilis almost weekly since it existed.  If you treat customers like this I can see why you are half empty now.  I expect your staff to ensure I get good food and best deal.  I'm upset over $6.  I'll probably need a few months to forger.  Hope someone else fills my seat.  Poor marketing and management!

I try never to give bad reviews, if my experience is bad I give the benefit of the doubt and move on. But this was so negative I had to share. Went there early on a Friday night and , despite ample free seats in the restaurant , we were seated at a high top in the bar. We ordered our food and asked that everything come together since we were in a hurry. Our order was for bacon ranch quesadillas, loaded fries, a steak, and a bacon cheeseburger . We watched table after table come in after us and get here food, and in some cases leave , before out food came. When our food came out it was cold and the steak, ordered medium rare, was past med well. I don't have high standards from a steak at Chilis so wouldn't have been a deal breaker except for the way management handled it. The manager came over and asked how things were and I asked him if my steak looked med rare. He said it looked medium to him. I said ' based in the photos given on the menu it's well done'. He then tells me the pics on the menu are "ridiculous". Then you might not want to use them as a guide for how your valued customers should order?!?!?!  Then he proceeds to argue with me saying others got their food earlier because they ordered sandwiches. When I pointed out that one table had sliders and the other had chicken fried steaks he walked away and i never saw him again. The waiter then came over and pointed out that he gave us $3 off. Not about the money ..... It's about the customer experience!!!!! Could have easily been handled professionally and would have been forgotten by now .... Instead I wouldn't go back to this Chilis if I was starving and it was the only place in town. Full disclosure , I don't go to Chilis often, but have had nothing but great experiences with both locations off of 281.
Service was great. Food on the other hand, was really bad. I honestly don't know how this place stays in business. Taste like every was microwaved.
Don't eat here. They weren't busy and never even got a drink order after 15min. I walked out.
Like any other chilis, nothing special.  Service was a lot quicker than other chili's I have been to and the food came out fairly fast.

My review is simple.  I got as far as seating and  luckily a menu and that was it.  No waiter.  After 10 mins I kindly told the little greeter woman and she was like "be there in a sec" Welp! A second passed adding ten minutes and I was outta there. Then when I left she said "Thank you" I was like for what? And she was like " Oh yeah ok bye" No apology or recognition that the service sucked. But its not her business, she gets paid by the hour, why should she care right?

We always have a great time. We eat at the bar and the bartenders are always attentive, the food is great and drinks always flowing. Had a funny moment when after the sports  game went off, the movie The Ten Commandments came on and we had to ask to change the channel. We saw all waitstaff start scrambling to change all the tv's. Lol I love the table top kiosks. Wonderful idea to play unlimited games for .99. Spent hours playing and watching the Spurs. Always enjoy going here.

Feeling like eating some baby back ribs. It's 7:39pm on January 1st 2015....they are out. WTF!?! What kind of business doesn't have their signature dish available. It's like going to McDonald's and they are out of  Bic Macs....silly  right?
I would say that this particular restaurant has one of the slowest service. It took a little over 5 min. For a refill of our drinks.  Also it's not even busy on a Sunday.

I have eaten at the Forum Chilis many times with great experience. Today I ordered online arrived about 5 min after the site said it was going to be ready. I paid for the order and then watched 3 more people come in, pay and take their food while I waited for another 15 min, when I finally got my food I drove home, I live about 5 min from the forum. The food was cold and my hamburger was so undercooked I was afraid to eat it. It was literally raw meat. I don't think I will go back to the forum Chilis for anything.

Went to this Chili's last night (Friday) and you can tell the place was staffed by either interns or rookies.  45 minute wait - ok, I get it, it's Friday night and lots of people were waiting.  We went in the bar to have a drink while we waited for our table.  Ordered long island ice teas for three of us.  All of the drinks tasted like lemonade (without any liquor), then my husband ordered a vodka martini (thinking how can they get that wrong?) and when the bar tender set it in front of him it looked like water from a dirty pond.  He swore he didn't put any olive juice in it.  It tasted as bad as it looked.  The second bartender replaced it with a new martini, she added a full jigger of vermouth (uhhh... we didn't ask for vermouth!).   That drink wasn't much better but my husband is a good sport and paid for it... although he didn't drink it.  While waiting for our table we noticed several tables in the bar empty for a long time, same thing in the dining area.  Lots of open tables!  Hello!?  LOTS of people waiting to be seated at those open tables.  The hostess (intern or sheer rookie) was walking around timidly asking people if they were the next names on the list... yes, I said "walking around asking people"!  Hmmm... most restaurants either call out your name or have a PA system.  You could tell the bartenders and hostess staff were inept and after about 45 minutes we decided that the food servers appeared to be in the same class.  We left.  Won't go back to this Chili's ever!

I don't usually review chains; what you find at one location you'll find at another, and whatever you do find isn't usually very good. My visit to Chili's was no exception, but I did have some pretty good customer service that warrants noting.  It was a crowded night when our party of seven arrived, and the floor manager herself came out to work out seating arrangements when it was clear that the other large parties wouldn't be leaving anytime soon. We were more than willing to oblige some mildly-cramped seating for our meal, so we worked something out. I feel bad for the server whenever I eat in large parties, but our server Astin was on top of things, replacing the chips and salsa, quick turnaround on the drinks, and he even had separate checks printed and ready to go when it was time to leave. No, the food's not the best, but if you're going to go somewhere, it's always nice to have a helpful staff ready to accommodate to your needs.
The service was awesome and fast! We came down here when the one in Converse was taking 5 years and a day to seat us an it was a pleasant alternative. Derek was a great server!
This is the best chilis in town. I've never had a problem here, all the servers are great and the bar tenders are very friendly and attentive.

Went here for lunch yesterday.  Poor service. Waited over 10 minutes before waiter took our drink order. Ordered fajitas. Corn tortillas were cold. The fajitas were unflavorful. Waiter came around only to take our order and drop off the check. A manager refilled our drinks. The experience just sucked.
I'm a Chili's fan! I always try to order something new. Try the lunch specials. You get a soup and a half sandwich and it really good stuff.

After Traveling for two days nonstop to get to Selma for work, we were excited to have a nice meal and relax. We were sat right away in Erik's section, who was fantastic! Very attentive and informative. He was even helping out at the bar when the bartender was busy. The manager on duty (12/12/13) was very authoritative. She ensured her employees were doing their jobs and her customers were satisfied. It was very apparent her managing was helping this location thrive. She even turned the heat up for us and came back twice to make sure we were warmer. She had a smile on her face the whole time they were there and her employees seemed to have a good relationship with her. Thanks!

I hate to admit it but the service, the burgers and the entire experience was great!  I was always told "Chili's" and similar chains were the "devil"  and death to mom and pop businesses but it is what it is...We had a great experience.

I actually didn't mind chili's too much. However, my most recent experience was shocking. #1 They did away with my favorite nachos.  That's pretty much the only thing I eat there. #2 The server had us sitting there (without asking for drinks or anything else) for about ten minutes. #3 When she DID arrive, she annoyed us. "Hey, what can I get you to drink?" (me starting to think) Uhh "Oh, I don't think we have uh, we might have um but not uh." After we ordered our drinks, and she scampered off to get them, we walked out of the restaurant.

The food is always good, even though portions have gotten smaller.  I especially liked our Chili's because they still had a smoking area in the bar.  I respect other peoples right to not smoke and think there should be separate rooms in the nicer chain restaurants.

After a long hot day, my family freshened up and went to Chili's.  To be pampered, spoiled, and fawned over by such a positive, courteous staff with such wonderful attitudes changed our day to one of bliss.  All that, even before we were served a variety of divinely tasty dishes that we could share with one another while we enjoyed a newly found party atmosphere!
